org.openimaj.tools.ocr

Class KNNCharacterClassifier

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.openimaj.tools.ocr.KNNCharacterClassifier

  • public class KNNCharacterClassifier
extends Object
    A class and tester for testing KNN classification of characters which are built randomly from the FontSimulator.

    In this base implementation, the pixels of the character images are used as the vector for classification which will achieve somewhere in the region of 60% correct classification for the characters 0-9 and somewhat worse for larger character ranges.

    Override the getImageVector(FImage) method to try different features. This class provides the training, classification and testing.

    Author:
    David Dupplaw (dpd@ecs.soton.ac.uk)

    • Nested Class Summary

      protected class  KNNCharacterClassifier.ImageTrainer
      This class is the FontSimulator.FontSimListener implementation that receives each character as an image in some randomised font.

    • Method Detail

      • getImageVector

        public double[] getImageVector(FImage img)
        Get the feature vector for a single image. Can be overridden to try different feature vectors for classification.
        Parameters:
        img - The character image.
        Returns:
        The feature vector for this image.

      • train

        public void train()
        Train the classifier by generating a bunch of random training examples of characters in various fonts (using the FontSimulator) and using the features extracted from those images, train a nearest neighbour classifier.

      • classify

        public char classify(FImage img)
        Classify the given image with the nearest neighbour classifier.
        Parameters:
        img - the character image to classify
        Returns:
        The classified character.

      • test

        public void test(int nTestRuns)
        Run a bunch of tests to determine how good the classifier is. It does this by creating a load of random examples of random characters using the FontSimulator and classifies them.
        Parameters:
        nTestRuns - The number of tests to run

      • main

        public static void main(String[] args)
        The main does a training run then a test run.
        Parameters:
        args -
